item.title: Lumma infostealer malware returns after law enforcement disruption
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Lumma infostealer malware operation is gradually resuming activities following a massive law enforcement operation in May, which resulted in the seizure of 2,300 domains and parts of its infrastructure. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5062660 update brings new 'Windows Resilience' features
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5062660 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with twenty-nine new features or changes, with many gradually rolling out, such as the new Black Screen of Death and Quick Machine Recovery tool. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 gets new Black Screen of Death, auto recovery tool
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft is rolling out significant changes to Windows 11 24H2 as part of the Windows Resilience Initiative, designed to reduce downtime and help devices recover from serious failures, as well as an overhaul of the all-too-familiar BSOD crash screens. [...]

item.title: Coyote malware abuses Windows accessibility framework for data theft
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new variant of the banking trojan 'Coyote' has begun abusing a Windows accessibility feature, Microsoft's UI Automation framework, to identify which banking and cryptocurrency exchange sites are accessed on the device for potential credential theft. [...]

item.title: CISA and FBI warn of escalating Interlock ransomware attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CISA and the FBI warned on Tuesday of increased Interlock ransomware activity targeting businesses and critical infrastructure organizations in double extortion attacks. [...]

item.title: Major European healthcare network discloses security breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: AMEOS Group, an operator of a massive healthcare network in Central Europe, has announced it has suffered a security breach that may have exposed customer, employee, and partner information. [...]

item.title: Cisco: Maximum-severity ISE RCE flaws now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cisco is warning that three recently patched critical remote code execution vulnerabilities in Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) are now being actively exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: UK to ban public sector orgs from paying ransomware gangs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The United Kingdom's government is planning to ban public sector and critical infrastructure organizations from paying ransoms after ransomware attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft links Sharepoint ToolShell attacks to Chinese hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Hackers with ties to the Chinese government have been linked to a recent wave of widespread attacks targeting a Microsoft SharePoint zero-day vulnerability chain. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows Server KB5062557 causes cluster, VM issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is asking businesses to reach out for support to mitigate a known issue causing Cluster service and VM restart issues after installing this month's Windows Server 2019 security updates. [...]

item.title: Intel announces end of Clear Linux OS project, archives GitHub repos
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Clear Linux OS team has announced the shutdown of the project, marking the end of its 10-year existence in the open-source ecosystem. [...]

item.title: Ring denies breach after users report suspicious logins
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ring is warning that a backend update bug is responsible for customers seeing a surge in unauthorized devices logged into their account on May 28th. [...]

item.title: ExpressVPN bug leaked user IPs in Remote Desktop sessions
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ExpressVPN has fixed a flaw in its Windows client that caused Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) traffic to bypass the virtual private network (VPN) tunnel, exposing the users' real IP addresses. [...]
